838956743:
[

Out of School Care Assistant

Company Name St Michael's Grammar School Company Location St Kilda

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Casual position



St Michael’s Grammar School is one of the leading co-educational, independent schools in Australia, providing exceptional learning opportunities to students from Kindergarten to Year 12. St Michael’s Grammar School was established by the Anglican Community of the Sisters of the Church on its current site in 1895.



St Michael’s Grammar School is renowned for its excellence in teaching and learning, diverse community, and creative and caring environment. The St Michael’s Grammar School community is united by strong values based on respect for self and others, wellbeing, autonomous thinking and expression, and meaningful connections with local and international communities.



We are looking for a committed Out of School Care Assistant to contribute to the provision of quality care and innovative, age appropriate programs for Years Prep-6. The Out of School Care Assistant will lead the planning and implementation of the Before School Care program and work towards an effective and collaborative OSC team, where individuals are encouraged to share and discuss ideas and approaches. You must be aligned with the School’s ethos, vision and values. You are curious, excited and invigorated by learning and are a continuous, autonomous learner who makes visible their own learning. You will possess a positive outlook, exceptional interpersonal skills and high emotional intelligence with demonstrated ability to build authentic, collaborative relationships.



The successful applicant will:



  • Have a Diploma in Children’s Services or a higher qualification

  • Display a genuine interest in and respect for all children

  • Be familiar with the National Quality Standards

  • Be willing to be involved in all aspects of the School’s program

  • Display a genuine interest in and respect for all children

  • Possess strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and interact with both adults and students

  • Have high level communication skills

  • Work independently but also as part of a dynamic, creative and collaborative team.

  • Have a current Working with Children check or be willing to obtain prior to commencement

  • Have a current Level II First Aid and CPR Certificate, Anaphylaxis Management Certificate and an Asthma Management certificate or willing to obtain prior to commencement

  • Have a current National Police Check or be willing to obtain prior to commencement



This is a casual position commencing immediately. Due to the casual nature of this position, please note that the hours required will be based on the operational requirements of the School. This may include working in Before School Care, Out of School Care or during the Holiday Program.



Key benefits of working at St Michael’s Grammar School include.



  • Competitive salaries

  • 10% superannuation

  • Staff health and wellbeing program

  • Social and fun team activities

  • Stimulating working environment (progressive, fast-paced)

  • On-site cafeteria with barista-made coffee

  • Pool and gym available for staff use

  • Innovative learning environment

  • Culture of celebrating success



St Michael’s Grammar School is committed to child safety. As such, the successful applicant will be expected to satisfy child protection screening, and adhere to the School’s Child Safe Policy and Code of Conduct. These documents may be downloaded from the Schools website.



For more information, please see the position description below.



If this sounds like the role you’ve been waiting for ’APPLY NOW’.



Please submit your details, resume and cover letter outlining in detail your experience and ability to meet the requirements of this role. Please note that applications without cover letters will not be considered.



If you would like to discuss this role, please contact Miss Anna Borovska, People and Strategy Officer, on 03 8530 3341.

Industry

  • Primary/Secondary Education

Employment Type

Temporary

Job Functions

  • Education

Job description


Qualified Early Childhood Educator

Applications close 16/09/2018

  • Salary: $38.62 per hour (inclusive of casual loading) & Superannuation
  • Casual
  • Great locations, fantastic benefits, training & development opportunities & more

The City of Stonnington is committed to the provision of high quality Early Years Services and values and respects children and families as individuals, providing nurturing, supportive, welcoming, safe and secure places for children to learn, grow and be.

We are looking for multiple enthusiastic and passionate Casual Early Childhood Educators to join our team of experienced staff to provide care and education to children in all four of Council’s Early Years Services located in Prahran, South Yarra, Windsor or Malvern for shifts between 7:15am – 6pm Monday to Friday.

Working as part of our dynamic and dedicated team, you will provide high quality care by planning, implementing and evaluating play and learning experiences for children in consultation with families and other educators. The City of Stonnington strives to provide environments, interactions and programs that nurture, stimulate and guide each child’s development.

The successful candidates will have a Diploma of Children’s Services or Bachelor of Early Childhood Education, a current and valid Working With Children Check and relevant training certificates including Anaphylaxis, Asthma and First Aid. Additionally, you will have excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively communicate with children and families, and have a genuine passion for early childhood education and care.

We are currently undergoing Enterprise Agreement negotiations which, if agreed, this position will have a new salary range of $40.60 per hour (inclusive of casual loading) + Superannuation.

At the City of Stonnington, ambition and expertise will be recognised and rewarded, in an environment that fosters personal career development as part of a unique team culture.
As an employee, you will have access to some fantastic benefits and be able to participate in staff wellbeing programs, previously nominated as a finalist in both the VicHealth and Worksafe Awards. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to access ongoing training and work for an organisation with a dedicated Green Team.
Work for Stonnington today. Work that matters. People who make a difference.

Submitting your application

A Position Description is attached below for your perusal which includes the Key Selection Criteria. Applicants must address the Key Selection Criteria as part of their application. To be eligible to apply for this position you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.

For further information on how to apply contact the Council’s Recruitment Officer on Ph: 03 8290 1333.
For position related queries, please contact Emma Bray on Ph: 82908201

About Bunnings

Bunnings is more than a home improvement retailer. Our ambition to provide our customers with the widest range of products at the lowest price is backed by our amazing team and their offer of best service.

People are the heart and soul of our business – at other companies that might be said but at Bunnings it our way of life. Operating in more than 360 locations across Australia & New Zealand, our 43,000 team members pride themselves on our guiding principles of integrity, respect, teamwork, achievement and innovation.

\xa0

This newly created opportunity has become available for an experienced Internal Communications Manager – Social Media. Reporting to the Team Engagement & Communications Manager, you will develop, innovate and manage internal communications social media strategies and programs to maximise team engagement across Australia and New Zealand. You will also be responsible for the creating and production of compelling content for Workplace.

\xa0

  • Work closely with external and internal stakeholders on the creation of content for Workplace social media platform
  • Lead change, deliver projects and programs that have successful outcomes

  • 12 weeks paid parental leave

\xa0

There is no ceiling on what you can achieve and Bunnings is a strong advocate of career progression.

Senior Sales Engineer

Company Name Cloudera Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 57 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

Knocking down technical barriers to the adoption of Cloudera’s products is the main responsibility of a Senior Sales Engineer at Cloudera. This includes being the technical part of the sales team focused on presenting Cloudera’s technology to help solve customers’ critical business problems. Another critical part of the role is ensuring the success of existing customers along with expanding the usage of Cloudera’s technology by discovering additional use cases within a customer’s organization. In order to do this successfully an understanding of a few key technologies is important, namely, databases, Java, distributed systems, data analytics and Linux.

Responsibilities
  • Engage with sales prospects where you prepare and present Cloudera’s technology along with addressing any technical questions that come up during the sales cycle
  • Support the technical needs of existing customers including discovering additional use cases for Cloudera’s technology
  • Work closely with the product management and engineering team to align customer requirements to future versions and products
  • Have a deep understanding of Cloudera’s technology and a willingness to learn new technologies when needed

Qualifications
  • Experience with performing customer facing activities as part of pre-sales team or professional services team
  • In-depth knowledge of the following:
    • Linux
    • Java
    • SQL – query optimization and data model design
  • Demonstrable ability to create and give technical presentations and demo
  • Excellent communicator who has experience presenting to a wide range of audiences

[

Senior Account Director - Experiential

Company Name George P. Johnson Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 197 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

With our exponential growth, we are seeking a Senior Account Director to join our Melbourne team.\xa0 This person will be required to lead a team supporting a range of clients with creative, content and experiential requirements across all facets of our client marketing activities online and offline.\xa0 The successful candidate will have experience in the automotive sector.


About Us
George P. Johnson is the world’s premier brand experience agency and is part of Project:WorldWide – an independent, global network of complementary, wholly-owned agencies.\xa0 We imagine, design, build and deliver the most innovative and award-winning experiential marketing programs in the world.

About The Role

As Senior Account Director, your responsibilities will include:


  • Lead and manage the client and key stakeholders at a senior level\xa0
  • Day-to-day, short, mid and long-term planning of the client/s account including playing an active role in the ongoing and new business opportunities the account/s present
  • Generating sales and managing the client’s event / marketing expectations from inception to completion
  • Building and growing meaningful relationships with your client/s, your direct team, entire GPJ agency and third-party suppliers
  • Developing and implementing a dynamic end-to-end event / marketing strategy for the client/s which needs to meet or exceed budgeted levels of revenue\xa0
  • Manage and control all required activities and costs related to the project requirements
  • Commercial, contractual, financial and general account management
  • Acting as gatekeeper of information on the account including company logos, brand books, product information, data and research etc.
  • Leading the creative development of project proposals with the production team, creative and strategy teams and any external third-party suppliers as required to ensure creative output is of the highest standards\xa0
  • Collaborate with the Senior Event Producer to manage the production team and foster best practice, mentoring, career development and team cohesion.\xa0 This includes conducting ongoing performance reviews ensuring clear objectives and goals are set, opportunities are provided to the team members for development and appropriate and timely follow-up and feedback is provided
  • Collaborate with the Strategy & Creative services teams to develop the most innovative and effective solutions.\xa0 GPJ’s ambition is to create award-winning work.
  • Disrupt event conventions and challenge everything – ensuring experiential best practices are implemented

About You

  • You will have 10+ years in an account leadership role within an event or marketing agency. \xa0Experience within the automotive sector is required
  • You will be passionate about creating the world of tomorrow.\xa0 You are resourceful and forward-thinking with relevant experience curating customer user journeys across digital and traditional marketing channels
  • This account leadership position requires a mix of visionary and strategic thinking.\xa0 A tenacious cross-functional top performer mentality to deliver on clients’ requirements.\xa0 It also requires a thorough understanding of data analytics and using data to derive target audience insights
  • Thorough understanding of Event, Marketing, Digital Marketing, Content, Registration and Production to solve Client/s problems and meet Client/s objectives using a multi-level approach
  • You want to be part of a high-growth, innovative experiential agency with a fantastic culture.


If you are interested in this position and believe you can deliver on the key responsibilities, please apply.


Applications for this position will close on Friday, 14 September 2018.

838972703:
[

Delivery Principal

Company Name DigIO Company Location 152 Elizabeth St, Melbourne Victoria 3000

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 200 views

Job description

We are searching for a talented Delivery Principal to join our rapidly growing team in Melbourne.


About Us:


  • Mantel Group is a house of brands company with two businesses:

    • DigIO – a digital services business providing technology consulting, software development and design services

    • Eliiza – a consulting and development company specialising in Artificial Intelligence

  • Seriously, we mean it when we say our people are our greatest asset so we go to extreme lengths to provide an environment where everyone can be their best.

  • We’re values-led and practical in the way we work towards creating value for our customers and our people.

  • Whilst we’re hard workers, we’re a fun-loving bunch and keep things balanced between work and life :)


About the role:


In your role as a Delivery Principal you’ll be accountable for building a culture of continuous improvement that fosters the development of a delivery capability that sets DigIO apart from others. You will be the champion of different delivery methods and not afraid to try new things that will have a positive impact on our clients and team.


Within our company no two days will be the same, whether this be day to day tasks, the industry we are working in or the type of work our teams are doing. That is why the most important skills you possess will be adaptability in your leadership and approaches based on the context of the situation.


Here’s an overview of some of the responsibilities you may have:


  • Define and develop the business value of the Delivery capability within DigIO so that our clients clearly understand how our delivery practices differ from others.

  • Define and implement delivery principles and a lean agile delivery framework to ensure that DigIO teams are successful

  • Creation of a career development framework to assist delivery team members with their professional development, whilst also providing mentoring and support

  • Develop delivery accelerators to get Digio teams up and running faster from a delivery perspective.

  • Develop a data driven continuous improvement culture to challenge and improve existing delivery processes.

  • Review the health of DigIO engagements, with a specific emphasis on the quality and frequency of communications to clients; specifically senior leaders.

  • Provide proactive coaching to mentoring members of the DigIO delivery team on lean agile methods and principles to assist them with \xa0delivery on client site.

  • Build a cohesive, collaborative and support Delivery team, that develop, improve and champion our delivery framework and DigIO principles with the broader DigIO team and our customers.

  • Develop and review of commercial documents

  • Support the management of client delivery escalations

  • You may be required from time to time to consult to, or lead the delivery of key DigIO projects, with the intent that the role will also perform billable customer work.


About you:


  • Experience at a senior level managing a Professional Services team with a proven track record of both delivery and client management

  • Experience in the delivery of custom software development projects in ASX100 or equivalent organisations

  • Strong commercial acumen with demonstrated experience in the development and management of commercial agreements

  • Highly developed executive level reporting and communication skills and an ability to provide relevant and timely information to stakeholders

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with strong leadership and communication skills

  • Strong time management skills with ability to prioritise workloads under pressure and meet deadlines

  • A self-starter who is hands on and knows how to find answers and work with ambiguity

  • Values driven and practical in your approach



What’s on offer


  • You’ll be joining a passionate and supportive team who’ll move mountains to help you achieve your objective

  • We have a culture of trust. We set clear expectations, provide feedback and opportunities and support you to grow

  • We don’t do policies or performance reviews or hierarchies or bureaucracy

  • We’re growing, so there will be plenty of opportunities to grow your career with us as we expand

  • The building we work in has kombucha, beer, cider on tap, plenty of open space including a rooftop deck and heaps of activities (like yoga, meditation and talks on leading topics) to get involved in to give you a break throughout the day

  • We trust you to get the job done and can offer flexible working arrangements

  • We are located in the heart of the CBD where there’s plenty of transportation options to make getting to and from work a breeze

  • You’ll get all the tools you need - a new iphone or Google phone, a laptop, and a lot of branded swag - t-shirts, hoodies, umbrellas, water bottle….

  • Lots of social activities - so far this year we have had regular breakfasts, lunches and drinks, hotly contested table tennis competition, twice weekly squash competitions, regular games nights, ski trip, Grand Prix

  • A learning organisation - we make a huge investment of time and money into our learning - attending conferences, hosting and attending ‘brown bag’ lunches, meet ups and supporting individual learning opportunities

  • Genuine support for your wellbeing including unlimited health leave, flu shots, counselling and psychological services, dietitian and financial advice

Client Solutions Advertising Executive

Company Name FOX SPORTS Australia Company Location 50 Dorcas St , Southbank, VIC 3006, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 324 views

Job description

At FOX SPORTS we strive to make every sporting contest better by taking our viewers closer to the game. As an employer, we will encourage you to step up and make your own confident mark.


To ensure that our content continues to set the standards for our industry, we are looking for a Client Solutions Advertising Executive\xa0to join our Ad Sales team.

\xa0

What will you do?

Reporting to the Client Solutions Manager, you will be responsible for delivering creative, integrated advertising campaigns across the FOX SPORTS platform - predominantly Fox Footy/AFL and Fox Cricket channels.


In this dynamic role you will:

  • Work in conjunction with sales agency - MCN, advertising agencies, clients and internal FOX SPORTS departments on advertising solutions and production requirements
  • Create a consistent, creative approach for FOX SPORTS integrations which supports the commercial sale of advertising to clients and agencies
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to create proactive, market leading advertising opportunities for MCN
  • Assist with advertising briefs throughout all stages from initial briefing to campaign completion
  • Support the management of documentation required for production (including TV shoots and Studio) and sales meetings
  • Maintain an awareness of the sports media and digital space i.e. new technologies and products, brand communications, market and competitor activity to identify new business opportunities

\xa0

What is your experience?

  • 3 years + media experience preferred; either media owner, publisher or agency
  • Tertiary qualified in media, advertising or marketing will be favourable
  • Proven experience in:
  • developing creative advertising solutions
  • operating in multi-stakeholder environments and building cross departmental relationships
  • Well-developed PC skills – Word, Excel and Powerpoint skills as well as the ability to learn in-house packages

\xa0

Who are you?

You are a highly motivated, organised and process driven individual with a real passion for sports and media. You demonstrate strong communication skills and can develop rapport within a multi-stakeholder environment. You are creative and enjoy pushing the boundaries to offer innovative solutions.

\xa0

What can we offer you?

  • Free FOXTEL sports HD value pack subscription
  • Competitive salary package
  • A fun, dynamic, inclusive team environment
  • State-of-the-art-premises easily accessible by trains and buses

\xa0

How to apply

Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position. As such, candidate’s visa or residency status will be checked before employment is offered.

If this sounds like the role for you then please submit your covering letter, resume and links to your work using the link below.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.


NO AGENCIES PLEASE


\xa0
